docs.lead_paragraph: FOR the first time the International Labor Organization, established in 1919, has chosen an American as its director. John G. Winant, former Governor of New Hampshire and first chairman of the United States Social Se curity Board, is the man. He takes officenext January.

headline.main: WINANT TALKS OF WORLD OUTLOOK FOR??; American Head of the I. L. O. Finds That There Are Reasons for Optimism Today WINANT TALKS OF LABOR'S OUTLOOK

docs.abstract: Winant on ILO role in labor outlook
